This will do so the player health will never go above the max health value.

If the current payer health + 12 > max health, add the value to not go above 99, else add 12 health.

en.wikipedia.org

?:

In computer programming, ?: is a ternary operator that is part of the syntax for basic conditional expressions in several programming languages. It is commonly referred to as the conditional operator, inline if (iif), or ternary if. An expression a ? b : c evaluates to b if the value of a is true, and otherwise to c. It originally comes from CPL, in which equivalent syntax for e1 ? e2 : e3 was e1 → e2, e3. Although many ternary operators are possible, the conditional operator is so common, and ot...

item.title: Health System In java -HELP- Ty
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

RSPS222:

Hash1 when to use return; when to use final and when to use static and public and private Ty

Final is a constant, so it’s a value that can’t be changed once initialized first.

Return goes out of the current function you’re in, so in this case, main (the whole program).

Static is independent from an object.

Public is when you can access the variable from another class.

Private is when you can only access that variable from the class you’re in.

Read full topic

item.title: Health System In java -HELP- Ty
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

Hope this can help you:

[code]import java.util.Scanner;

public class Player {

public static void main(String args[]) {
	int playerXP = 0;
	int[] playerBankSize = new int[100];
	int playerMoney = 1;
	int playerHealth = 10;
	final int MAX_HEALTH = 99;
    
	boolean isMember = false;
    String answer;
    
    Scanner scanner = new Scanner(System.in);
   
    for(int i = 0; i < playerBankSize.length; i++)
            playerBankSize[i] = 0;
    
    if(isMember)
            System.out.println("You are member");
    else
        	System.out.println("You are not member");
            
    System.out.println("Your Xp is : " + playerXP);
    System.out.println("Your Health is : " + playerHealth);
    System.out.println("Your BankSize is : " + playerBankSize.length);
    System.out.println("Want to buy something ? if so press B");
    answer = scanner.next();
    
    if(answer.equalsIgnoreCase("B"))
    	System.out.println("What would you like to buy?(Options:/Health/)");
    else {
    	System.out.println("See ya later!");
    	return;
    }
    
    	answer = scanner.next();
   
    	if(answer.equalsIgnoreCase("Health")) {
             if(playerMoney >= 1 && playerHealth <= 100) {
            	 playerHealth += playerHealth + 12 > MAX_HEALTH ? MAX_HEALTH - playerHealth : 12;
            	 System.out.println("Your Health is : " +playerHealth);
             }
             else
                 System.out.println("Or your health is too low or you don't have enought money!");
    	}
}

}[/code]

item.title: Health System In java -HELP- Ty
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

Ty guys i am learning Java
thank you for your help i think this code will work fine
-Edit
can you help me ?
look at the all code:

public class p { public static int playerXP = 0; public static int[] playerBankSize = new int[100]; public static int playerMoney = 1; public static int playerHealth = 99; public static int maxHealth = 99; public static void main(String args[]){ boolean isMember = false; String answer; Scanner ok = new Scanner(System.in); for(int x=0;x<playerBankSize.length;x++){ playerBankSize[x] = 0; } if(isMember){ System.out.println("You are member"); }else{ if(isMember==false){ System.out.println("You are not member"); } } System.out.println("Your Xp is : " +playerXP); System.out.println("Your Health is : " +playerHealth); System.out.println("Your BankSize is : " +playerBankSize); System.out.println("Want to buy something ? if so press B"); answer = ok.next(); if(answer.equalsIgnoreCase("B")) { System.out.println("What would you like to buy?(Options:/Health/)"); answer = ok.next(); if(answer.equalsIgnoreCase("Health")) { if(playerMoney>=1 && playerHealth <= 100){ if(playerHealth < maxHealth) { playerHealth+=12; System.out.println("Your Health is : " +playerHealth); } }else{ System.out.println("Or your health is too low or you dont have enought money!"); } } } }

item.title: Health System In java -HELP- Ty
item.dc:creator: @Hash1 Hash1
item.description:
@Hash1 wrote:

[quote=“imthenull, post:2, topic:478081”]It’s a simple if statement…

if (playerHealth < maxHealth) { // eat food }

I suggest you learn the language basics.[/code][/quote]

This will make him go over max health.

if (player.health > player.maxHealth)
    player.health = player.maxHealth;

You should also make max health a constant since you don’t modify that variable.
